responses.rationale: The segment describes the problem of virus spread and mutation, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes a difficulty in preventing virus entry, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the spread of cases, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the impact of the disease (slaughter), not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports price data, not capabilities or preparedness.

Describes safeguards/preparedness measures: 'requiring workers to shower', 'sanitizing trucks', 'investing in separate sets of tools'.
Describes safeguards/preparedness measures: 'upgraded barn ventilation', 'installed laser systems'.
Describes a preparedness recommendation: 'biosecurity, biosecurity, biosecurity'.
The segment describes the cost of the response, not capabilities or preparedness measures themselves.
Mentions applying 'lessons learned', implying improved capability/preparedness.
Describes a safeguard/prevention measure: 'Properly cooking poultry and eggs... will also kill any viruses'.
Describes a development capability/future possibility: 'Bird flu vaccines are being developed and might help in the future'.
The segment discusses the limitations/cost of vaccination, not the capability itself or a safeguard being implemented.
The segment reports confirmed cases and locations, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes virus spread and impact, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes response/safeguard measures: 'affected areas have been quarantined and birds on the properties will be depopulated'.
Describes a response action: 'a commercial flock... were set to be euthanized'.
Describes response/safeguard measures: 'birds would 'be humanely depopulated and disposed of'', 'farm had also been quarantined'.
The segment reports the total impact (birds killed), not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a preparedness/capability: 'The United States has the strongest AI surveillance program', 'USDA is working... to actively look for the disease'.

Describes safeguard measures/protocols: 'Permits are required to move birds... within restricted and control areas'.
Describes implemented safeguards and following protocols: 'implementing strict biosecurity measures', 'following the national response'.
